intro: Linaria aegyptiaca subsp. tibestica, commonly known as the Tibesti linaria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Tibesti Mountains in Chad. It belongs to the plant family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. Its flowering period occurs during the rainy season, usually from July to September, and it plays a minor role in local ecosystems as a source of nectar for pollinators.
